Aab:
Watermark A.a.b. can be distinguished by several features: the top of the basel crosier is on a crowned shield, the central band of the crown contains three groups of triple circles and the initials EHM can be found below the shield. This watermark is a twinmark with Basel Crosier, A.a.a.

________________________________________________________________________

This watermark can be found on the following prints:

  • Self-portrait in a cap and scarf with the face dark: bus, 1633, (B. 17 ii/ NHD 120 ii), Private Collection, USA (PCU B.17ii). Folio sheet.
  • The angel appearing to the shepherds, 1634, (B. 44 iii/ NHD 125 iii), Art Institute, Chicago (AIC 1938.1737). Uncut broadsheet.
  • The angel appearing to the shepherds, 1634, (B. 44 iii/ NHD 125 iii), Private Collection, Switzerland (PCS B.44iii). Uncut broadsheet.
  • The angel appearing to the shepherds, 1634, (B. 44 iii/ NHD 125 iii), Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York (MMA 20.46.14). Uncut broadsheet.
  • The angel appearing to the shepherds, 1634, (B. 44 iii/ NHD 125 iii), British Museum, London (BM 1973-U.852). Uncut broadsheet.
  • The flight into Egypt: small plate, 1633, (B. 52 i/ NHD 117 i), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK OB.304). Quarto sheet.
  • The tribute money, circa 1635, (B. 68 i/ NHD 138 i), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK OB.132). Quarto sheet.
  • Man making water, 1631, (B. 190 only state/ NHD 52 ii), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK 61:1100). Quarto sheet.
  • Bald-headed man in profile to the right [Rembrandt’s father?], 1630, (B. 292 iii/ NHD 62 v), British Museum, London (BM 1843-6-7-174). Quarto sheet.
  • Bust of an old man with a flowing beard, the head bowed forward, 1630, (B. 325 only state/ NHD 64 only state), Frits Lugt Collection, Institut Néerlandais, Paris (FLC 6898). Quarto sheet.
  • Woman reading, 1634, (B. 345 i/ NHD 137 i), Rijksprentenkabinet, Amsterdam (RPK 61:1190). Folio sheet.

(Erik Hinterding, Rembrandt as an Etcher, 2006, II, 61)
